content.description: Do an awkward sit start on decent holds with a good foot on a very chossy block on the left. Pull up to gain the sloper at the top of the wall, then top out.
content.location: It is on the leftmost side of the wall.

content.description: Sit start on good hand holds but tricky foot holds. Fire up to an angled crack at the top of the wall, get feet up, and top out. Unlike the other Bulges, the topout on this one is much more secure. The first move is the crux.
content.location: It is to the right of Bulge 2.

content.description: Sit start with your hands matched on a decent seam. Pull up to either some crimps on your left or a mini-pinch on your right. Then top out over the bulge.
content.protection: 1 pad and ideally a spotter. The topout is less sketchy than Bulge, but it is still a bit tricky.
content.location: It is just to the right of Bulge.

content.description: Squat start matched on a decent ledge with bad foot holds. Move up to a slopey hold and then a crimpy rail. Topping out over the bulge is the crux - the top is rounded and pretty bare.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter for the sketchy topout.
content.location: It is in the center of the wall.

content.description: Red Cross Slab is a small wall right off of Red Cross Path with some fun slab lines. There's potential for a challenging traverse here as well.
